Universal Containers (UC) wants to build a Recruiting app that allows for multiple Positions to appear on custom objects Websites and Postings. UC requires a report that shows the related custom objects of Postings.
Which two items should an app builder configure to implement this? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AB
A-UC requires a report that shows the related custom objects of Postings, you'll need to create custom report types. Standard report types won't provide the ability to traverse the custom relationships you've created. B-Lookup relationships are appropriate when you want to create a many-to-one relationship between Postings and Positions, and Postings and Websites. C-This allows a single Posting to be related to one Position and one Website.Master-detail relationships create a strong ownership dependency. If a Position or Website record is deleted, the related Postings would also be deleted. This is likely not the desired behavior.D-Standard report types will not include custom objects or relationships. Therefore, they cannot be used to create the required report.
It should be C and not B, because if you delete a Posting record you also want the related record on the child objects to de removed

If C is right, which all claim, then D is the other correct answer because:
When custom objects and custom master detail relationships are created Salesforce will often automatically create "standard" report types.
